data.enText: the act of remembering who sb is when you see them, or of identifying what sth is

data.chText: 他瞥了她一眼，但似乎没认出她来。
data.enText: He glanced briefly towards her but there was no sign of recognition.

data.chText: 计算机对手写或印刷文本的自动识别
data.enText: the automatic recognition of handwriting and printed text by computer
the act of accepting that sth exists, is true or is official

data.chText: 越来越多的人认识到老年人也是有潜力的
data.enText: a growing recognition that older people have potential too

data.chText: 人们普遍认识到迫切需要改革。
data.enText: There is a general recognition of the urgent need for reform.

data.chText: 寻求国际上的 / 官方 / 正式的承认，承认它是一个主权国家
data.enText: to seek international/official/formal recognition as a sovereign state
public praise and reward for sb's work or actions

data.chText: 她的工作仅仅得到极少的赞誉。
data.enText: She gained only minimal recognition for her work.

data.chText: 他受到了奖励，这是对他过去一年的成绩的肯定。
data.enText: He received the award in recognition of his success over the past year.
to change, alter, etc. beyond/out of (all) recognition

data.chText: 变得面目全非；沧海桑田
data.enText: to change so much that you can hardly recognize it

data.chText: 自从我上次离开这里以来，这座小镇已经变得让人认不出来了。
data.enText: The town has changed beyond recognition since I was last here.
to change, alter, etc. beyond/out of (all) recognition

data.chText: 变得面目全非；沧海桑田
data.enText: to change so much that you can hardly recognize it

data.chText: 自从我上次离开这里以来，这座小镇已经变得让人认不出来了。
data.enText: The town has changed beyond recognition since I was last here.

tr: designation by the chair granting a person the right to speak in a deliberative body
example: he was unable to make his motion because he couldn't get recognition by the chairman

tr: the process of recognizing something or someone by remembering
example: a politician whose recall of names was as remarkable as his recognition of faces
experimental psychologists measure the elapsed time from the onset of the stimulus to its recognition by the observer

tr: coming to understand something clearly and distinctly
example: a growing realization of the risk involved
a sudden recognition of the problem he faced
increasing recognition that diabetes frequently coexists with other chronic diseases

tr: an acceptance (as of a claim) as true and valid
example: the recognition of the Rio Grande as a boundary between Mexico and the United States
he was given credit for his work

tr: the explicit and formal acknowledgement of a government or of the national independence of a country
example: territorial disputes were resolved in Guatemala's recognition of Belize in 1991

tr: (biology) the ability of one molecule to attach to another molecule that has a complementary shape
example: molecular recognition drives all of biology, for instance, hormone and receptor or antibody-antigen interactions or the organization of molecules into larger biologically active entities

tr: the state or quality of being recognized or acknowledged
example: the partners were delighted with the recognition of their work
she seems to avoid much in the way of recognition or acknowledgement of feminist work prior to her own

value.def: Recognition is the act of recognizing someone or identifying something when you see it.

example.ex: George said, 'Ida, how are you?' She frowned for a moment and then recognition dawned. 'George Black. Well, I never.'...
example.tran: 乔治说：“艾达，你好吗？”她皱了一会儿眉头，然后才认出他。“乔治·布莱克，噢，我一直都不好。”

example.ex: He searched for a sign of recognition on her face, but there was none.
example.tran: 他试图在她的脸上找出一丝认出他的神情，但是根本没有。

value.def: Recognition of something is an understanding and acceptance of it.

example.ex: The CBI welcomed the Chancellor's recognition of the recession and hoped for a reduction in interest rates.
example.tran: 英国工业联合会对财政大臣承认经济出现衰退表示欢迎，并希望能出台降低利率的政策。

value.def: When a government gives diplomatic recognition to another country, they officially accept that its status is valid.

example.ex: South Africa gave diplomatic recognition to Rwanda's new government on September 15...
example.tran: 南非于9月15日正式承认了卢旺达的新政府。

example.ex: His government did not receive full recognition by Britain until July.
example.tran: 他的政府直到7月份才得到英国的正式承认。

value.tran: （政府对他国的）外交认可，正式承认

value.def: When a person receives recognition for the things that they have done, people acknowledge the value or skill of their work.

example.ex: At last, her father's work has received popular recognition...
example.tran: 最后，她父亲的工作得到了大众的认可。

example.ex: He is an outstanding goalscorer who doesn't get the recognition he deserves.
example.tran: 他是一个出色的射手，但并没有获得应有的认可。

value.def: If you say that someone or something has changed beyond recognition or out of all recognition, you mean that person or thing has changed so much that you can no longer recognize them.

example.ex: The bodies were mutilated beyond recognition...
example.tran: 尸体都残缺不全，无法辨认了。

example.ex: The facilities have improved beyond all recognition...
example.tran: 这些设备经过大幅度的改良，都让人认不出来了。

example.ex: The situation in Eastern Europe has changed out of all recognition.
example.tran: 东欧的形势经历了巨变。

value.tran: 面目全非;认不出来;无法辨认

value.def: If something is done in recognition of someone's achievements, it is done as a way of showing official appreciation of them.

example.ex: Brazil normalised its diplomatic relations with South Africa in recognition of the steps taken to end apartheid...
example.tran: 巴西恢复了与南非的外交关系，以示对其采取措施结束种族隔离的正式认可。

example.ex: He had just received a doctorate in recognition of his contributions to seismology.
example.tran: 他刚被授予了博士头衔以表彰他对地震学作出的贡献。

trans: 模式识别
识别系统
语音识别；語音辨識；語音識別；语言识别；语音辨认

语音识别功能；语音识别；语音辨识；语音识别技术；声音识别

最容易获得认可的；公众认识阶段；公众承认；公共承认

面目全非;认不出来;无法辨认
姿态识别；手势识别；手势辨识；动作识别；姿势识别
手写识别；手写识别系统；手写体识别；手写辨识；笔迹识别
外交承认
收入确认；营收确认；收入什么时间入账；收入的确认；收入认列原则
细胞识别
